item.title: China | Large deposit with more than 40 tons of gold discovered
item.description: The Chinese province of Gansu announced the discovery of a new large gold deposit in the Qianhongquan-Heishanbeitan area, in the municipality of Yumen, with reserves estimated at more than 40 tons, state television CCTV reported yesterday. According to the provincial Department of Natural Resources, the discovery is equivalent, in volume, to two large gold mines and adds to the deposits already identified in the Beishan belt, one of the main gold hubs in the region. Gansu ranks second in China in terms of gold reserves. In recent years, the local government has intensified prospecting within the scope of the national geological exploration plan, with a greater concentration of investments in the north of the province. The exploration project in Qianhongquan received a total investment of 76.28 million yuan and made it possible to complete 30,000 cubic meters of excavations and more than 35,000 meters of drilling, according to CCTV. The work resulted in the identification of a new mineralized strip approximately 14 kilometers long and between 10 and 100 meters wide, with reserves of more than 40 tons of gold. The discovery in Gansu occurs in a context of strong appreciation of gold, whose price recently surpassed 4,000 dollars per ounce, reaching a new historic high. The precious metal has risen by more than 50 percent since the beginning of the year, driven by the weakness of the dollar, geopolitical tensions and purchases by central banks – especially from emerging economies – that seek to diversify their reserves. In recent years, the growth of the Chinese middle class and the demand for bullion as a form of protection against global macroeconomic volatility have also contributed to the increase in domestic demand for the precious metal.

item.title: LAG 2026 | Macau in a “key phase” of diversification, says secretary
item.description: The Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip, recently met with several associations in order to obtain their opinions for the preparation of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for next year. Quoted in an official note, Tai Kin Ip considered that “Macau is at a key stage in promoting economic diversification”, having promised, within the scope of these meetings, “to further optimize the business environment”. Another of the guarantees left by the government official refers to “support for small and medium-sized companies to improve their quality, stabilize local employment, create more development opportunities for residents and continually improve measures to guarantee the well-being of the population”. The General Association of Women of Macau, General Association of Fukien Countrymen of Macau, Macau Institution People's Alliance, General Union of Residents' Associations of Macau, Commercial Association of Macau, Industrial Association of Macau, Macau Youth Federation, Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau and General Association of Overseas Chinese of Macau met with Tai Kin Ip.

item.title: Tourism | Andy Wu calls for greater disclosure of intangible heritage
item.description: Andy Wu, president of the Macau Tourism Industry Association, argues that intangible cultural heritage should be more widely publicized to tourists, at a time when the Cultural Institute has just announced 12 new classifications, namely the making of cream puffs and traditional almond cookies, traditional Chinese wedding cakes and the making of jook-sing dough. According to the newspaper Ou Mun, the association leader understands that cultural tourism offers can include intangible cultural heritage, providing extraordinary experiences to tourists, namely the holding of custard tart and almond biscuit workshops, among others. This type of event would be organized between the sector, education linked to tourism and personalities from society, so that visitors would have more information about the production process. Andy Wu hopes that the Government will provide more support as he understands that these initiatives can help to overcome the lack of spaces for tourists to have these types of experiences. Few stores still make traditional Chinese wedding cakes.

item.title: Photography | Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro distinguished at Budapest International Photo
item.description: Portuguese photojournalist Gonçalo Lobo Pinheiro, based in Macau for over 15 years, was awarded the Gold award in the Editorial/Political category of the prestigious Budapest International Foto Awards (BIFA), with a photo report on the visit of the President of the People's Republic of China, Xi Jinping, to Macau, during the celebrations of the 25th anniversary of the MSAR. Created for Agência Lusa, the photographic series documents key moments of the presidential visit, with images that capture the solemn atmosphere of the official ceremonies and the political symbolism of the occasion. "I am very happy with this achievement. This photographic series documents key moments of President Xi Jinping's visit to Macau to mark the 25th anniversary of the MSAR. With images of the President and the authorities who accompanied him, the report portrays the formal atmosphere of the celebrations, highlighting the political weight of the visit", said the photojournalist, former editor of HM, quoted in a statement. The photographs, marked by rigorous framing and close observation, reveal the choreography of State protocol, the symbolism of unity and the persistent ties between Macau and mainland China at this historical moment. “Through careful compositions and a close look, I sought to reflect the ceremonial staging and the importance of the moment for Macau and its relationship with Beijing.” The award reinforces the international recognition of press photography produced in Macau and highlights the fundamental role of photojournalism in documenting political events of global importance, highlights the same note.

item.title: Fire leads to two hospitalizations and evacuation of 50 people
item.description: Two people had to be admitted to Kiang Wu Hospital, after a fire broke out on Wednesday night, in the Si Keng Building, on Rua da Alegria. In addition to the injured, there was also a need to remove 50 residents from the building, according to information released yesterday by the newspaper Ou Mun. Those hospitalized are two residents aged around 60, one male and one female, who reportedly showed signs of being unwell after inhaling smoke from the fire. Despite their indisposition, their clinical situation was considered stable. The remaining residents also managed to leave the building by their own means and did not present any type of discomfort or injuries. The flames began to break out at around 11:44 pm, when authorities were alerted to the situation. The arrival at the scene of both the Fire Department (CB) and the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) took place minutes later, at a time when several of the building's inhabitants were already on the street. At the scene, firefighters had to climb to the third floor, where the fire originated. Fighting the flames took a few minutes. Traces indicate that the flames broke out next to a vase with flowers, and then reached the living room of the apartment on the third floor. During the fight against the fire, authorities closed Rua da Alegria and Estrada do Repouso to traffic for several minutes. Firefighters used water to fight the fire, which resulted in a burned area measuring 2.5 meters long and 1 meter wide. From the origins According to the newspaper Ou Mun, the CB suspects that the flames originated from a short circuit in a washing machine, positioned next to the vase with flowers. In addition to the burned area, the washing machine, a purifier, an air conditioner and other appliances and goods were also destroyed. According to the most recent data, in the first six months of the year, the CB was called to intervene in 406 fires. Among these, firefighters had to use hoses to extinguish the flames on 85 occasions. In the remaining 321 fires, the flames were extinguished without using a hose. Official information also revealed that 78 of the 406 fires originated from burnt food.

item.title: Hengqin | Portuguese restaurant opens across the border
item.description: It’s called “Vivo” and it’s a Mediterranean cuisine restaurant that opens its doors tomorrow in Hengqin. João Maria Pegado, one of the project's partners and previously linked to sport, is now investing in the restaurant sector and has high expectations given the tourist demand on the island. A Mediterranean cuisine restaurant officially opens tomorrow in Hengqin. Located in the Huafa shopping center, the Vivo restaurant is a project by two Portuguese people who saw an opportunity to bring two geographies closer together – China and southern Europe. It's not about fusion cuisine. Still, several traditions coexist in this restaurant: Portuguese, Spanish and Italian cuisine, prepared by a chef from Shanghai with Chinese raw materials. “We are in China, we want to invest in fresh Chinese products”, one of the partners, João Maria Pegado, tells Lusa. So much so that, for now, there is no traditional octopus à lagareiro on the menu. You have to continue browsing local markets until you find the ideal product, explains Pegado. "We could go to Macau to get frozen octopus, but our main objective was to work with fresh products in China. In terms of cost, it makes it much more profitable, but we also want to take advantage and create this fusion between Chinese products and Portuguese dishes", he says. Vivo has been in ‘soft opening’ mode since July 18th. And João Maria Pegado does not complain about the journey he has taken so far, despite the difficulty of the language. More and more To Lusa, Pegado says he will soon compete for support from the Macau Government, at a time when authorities are encouraging investment in the Macau-Guangdong Deep Cooperation Zone, in Hengqin. And this region attracts more and more visitors to Macau, says the investor. In this area managed by both sides of the border, the movement of drivers from Macau is now permitted, for example, upon request for a license, recalls Pegado. But there are other attractions: gasoline is cheaper – “the cars in Macau come to fill up at the weekend, we [Portuguese] are like in Badajoz” – supermarkets are more affordable, more space and more green areas. "An open space where you can relax without being in the middle of the city. That's the big reason why people leave Macau for Hengqin on the weekend and sometimes even during the week, at lunchtime", he reflects. Hengqin also seems to be a more economical option for Chinese people visiting Macau, where, according to data for August, the average price of a hotel room is 1,461 patacas. "Hengqin has increasingly become a point of concentration, of sleeping, used by many visitors. Many of the buildings that were built as offices, the Government gave licenses (…) to build Airbnb-style hotels [local accommodation]", he said. Hong Kong and Macau are, for now, the origin of the majority of the restaurant's visitors, but João Maria Pegado also hopes to reach more consumers from the interior of China. “There are still few people who know what Mediterranean [the concept] means”, he highlights, noting, however, that, for many of those who have visited Vivo, black paella has been a recurring choice. This dish is joined by other specialties of the house, such as fisherman's rice, guilloche prawns or barbecue chicken, says Pegado, who left a career linked to sport to dedicate himself to the restaurant business. “It’s special”, he admits. “I felt that there was a lack of a Western food restaurant, and that it could be successful in that area (…). I have lived in Hengqin for three years and it is a place that I really appreciate, it allows me to be close to Macau, the city where I grew up and with which I feel identified”, he concludes.

item.title: Macau | IMF cuts growth forecast to 2.6 percent
item.description: For the second time this year, the IMF revised growth forecasts for Macau's economy. In April, the initial forecast of 7.3 percent was cut to 3.6. Now it is believed that economic expansion will not even reach 3.0 percent The International Monetary Fund (IMF) expects Macau's economy to grow 2.6 percent throughout this year. The new estimate released yesterday, and cited by the Macau News Agency, means a downward revision of the previous forecast, which pointed to an annual expansion of 3.6 percent. In the first half of the year, the territory showed annual growth of 2.8 percent, however, the IMF believes that the pace has been slowing down since July. The data used by the IMF to make the estimate assumes that inflation throughout this year should remain at 0.5 percent, a reduction from the previous forecast of 0.9 percent. The downward revision of estimates is not limited to forecasts for this year. Next year's annual increase was also revised downwards to 2.8 percent. The IMF's previous estimate, from April, predicted an expansion of 3.5 percent. Last year Macau's economy grew 8.8 percent. In the first ten months of the year, gross revenue from gambling, Macau's main economic activity, showed an annual growth of 7.1 percent, to 181.34 billion patacas, compared to 169.35 billion patacas. However, revenues during Golden Week, at the beginning of October, were below expectations. The IMF's expectations fall short of the forecasts of the Macau Economic Association, led by deputy Joey Lao, which points to annual growth of 4.5 percent. Opposite trends The IMF's downward revision of Macau's expansion estimates contrasts with the scenario in Hong Kong and the interior. In the HKSAR, an increase is expected throughout this year that is lower than that recorded in the Macao SAR. However, the most recent estimate points to an increase of 2.4 percent, when an expansion of 1.5 percent was previously expected. In the Interior, estimates are also now more optimistic. In April, the economy was expected to grow 4 percent, which has now been revised to 4.8 percent, above the levels of Macau and Hong Kong. This is the second time this year that estimates for Macau's economy have been revised downwards by the IMF. Before the start of the year, economic expansion of around 7.3 percent was expected. However, in April, the value was cut to 3.6 percent. At the time, Macau was affected, like world trade, by the impact of the tariff policy adopted in the United States.

item.title: Government reformulation | Chan Tsz King admits he has little experience in the area
item.description: The new Secretary for Security, Chan Tsz King, admitted yesterday that he had little experience for the position he has held since yesterday, replacing Wong Sio Chak. “For me, this is a very big challenge because I have never had contact with the security area and have little experience in this area”, he said, according to statements reproduced by TDM. The new secretary highlighted the quality of the team he will work with, which has “experienced personnel”, namely the director general of the Customs Services and Unitary Police Services. Furthermore, Chan Tsz King highlighted that “the issue of national security is very important for Macau society”, awaiting “long-term developments and legal diplomas that are being produced”. Regarding the Lines of Government Action (LAG) for next year, for this guardianship, Chan Tsz King said that they are already being prepared. “For my part, the main thing is to adjust to this area and master the details.” Chan Tsz King was a commissioner of the Commissariat against Corruption (CCAC), between 2019 and 2024, but began his career in public service as a delegate of the Public Prosecutor's Office in 1997. He was then promoted to the position of deputy prosecutor in March 2000, having been seconded to carry out duties in the Public Prosecutor's Service at the Courts of Second and Final Instances from January 2012 to December 2019. The new Secretary for Security was born in Hong Kong in 1970 and has higher education completed in Portugal, namely at the Faculty of Arts of the University of Lisbon in Portugal, completed in 1989, and a Law course completed at the Autonomous University of Lisbon in Portugal in 1995. MP | Tong Hio Fong talks “great responsibility” Tong Hio Fong, who assumed the role of Public Prosecutor (MP) of the Macao SAR yesterday, as part of the government reform, thanked the “confidence of the Central Government and the Chief Executive” in assuming an “important and highly responsible position”. The official also added that he will “contribute to the development of the Macao SAR”, describing the territory as a successful example of the practice of one country, two systems, with “long-term stability and prosperity being ensured by the rule of law”. In turn, Tong Hio Fong said that the MP “is an important institution to defend the rule of law, being responsible for defending the dignity of the law, protecting the rights of citizens and combating illegal activities”. As Prosecutor, he promised to focus “on the principle of the rule of law, apply the law rigorously and fairly and strengthen inspection of judicial activities”, as well as “increase judicial efficiency”. Administration | Wong Sio Chak collects opinions on markets Upon assuming a vast portfolio, that of Administration and Justice, Wong Sio Chak, former Secretary for Security, promised that, in the coming weeks, he will listen to the population's opinions regarding the functioning of markets. "In the near future I will visit the communities, in particular the markets. I will continue to do this [listen to opinions]. The means to receive the public's opinions are always unimpeded", he told the press. To journalists, Wong Sio Chak thanked the work carried out by his predecessor, André Cheong, ensuring that he will now focus on four areas that he believes are priorities, such as the reform of Public Administration, strengthening the construction of “One country, two systems”, greater efficiency in governance and promoting integration in the Greater Bay Area and the Hengqin Deep Cooperation Zone. "Regardless of government or local services, it is easy to appear bad habits, such as sectarianism, bureaucracy or isolated actions. These situations also occur in Macau and we need to change that. We need to facilitate horizontal communication [within the Public Service] and increase the effectiveness of cooperation", he added. Wong Sio Chak argued that it is necessary to “increase staff capacity, explore their potential and make good use of talent, optimizing the allocation of employees”. In this way, the government official considers that “it is necessary to create more concrete training actions, especially in the capacity building of services”. Wong Sio Chak, was born in Guangdong province in 1968 and graduated in Law from Peking University. After a long career in the Judiciary Police, he was appointed Secretary for Security in 2014.

item.title: Legislative Assembly | André Cheong unanimously elected president
item.description: Cheong Weng Chon, Cheong Weng Chon and Cheong Weng Chon... was the name repeated by the 33 deputies in the voting papers, including his own, which confirmed the choice of the new president of the AL “I want to take on this position”, this is how André Cheong reacted after being elected the new president of the Legislative Assembly. Later, the former secretary for Administration and Justice reminded journalists that the new legislative session will have “new deputies from different industries” and will take into account “the successful experiences of the last seven legislatures”. “I hope that there will be progress in legislative and supervisory work, so that the governance of the Macao SAR can be carried out with greater cooperation from the Legislative Assembly (AL)”, he added. André Cheong also said he hopes that “the projects and law proposals and policies [of the Executive] correspond to the opinions of the population and social hope through the AL, which is an important platform”. In yesterday's session, before the election, José Pereira Coutinho, the oldest deputy at 67 years old, was responsible for conducting the work of the first plenary, as traditionally happens. Speaking exclusively in Cantonese, the Portuguese proposed that the votes on the future president of the hemicycle be counted by the youngest deputies Chan Lai Kei and Loi I Weng. The proposal was approved by all deputies, after a vote with a show of hands. A new vote followed, secret and with a ballot paper, to choose the future president of the Legislative Assembly. An orderly procedure, with deputies standing up according to their place in the hemicycle's rows, and which only highlighted the future president's difficulties in folding the ballot paper, which he had to do when he was already in front of the ballot box, and after a first failed attempt. Once the vote was over, Chan Lai Kei and Loi I Weng read their vote and that of their colleagues and the name Cheong Weng Chon was repeated 33 times, which confirmed that the person who until yesterday was the Government's number two, as secretary for Administration and Justice, would be the new president of the hemicycle. With unanimity confirmed, José Pereira Coutinho addressed the now deputy appointed by the Chief Executive and asked him if he accepted the new position: “I want to take on this position”, replied André Cheong. Different results Yesterday's vote also marked a difference compared to what happened in 2019 and 2021, when Kou Hoi In was elected president of the hemicycle. In 2019, Kou was chosen president in the middle of a Legislature, after Ho Iat Seng abdicated his position as deputy to run for Chief Executive. In that vote, when the hemicycle was operating with only 32 deputies, given the place left free by Ho, Kou was elected with 29 votes in favor, José Pereira Coutinho had one vote and there were two blank votes. In 2021, Kou Hoi In was re-elected, in a parliament that for the first time had seen several candidate deputies excluded for political reasons. Still, despite there being 33 voters, Kou had 32 votes, since José Chui Sai Peng also gathered one vote. Unprecedented case In almost 25 years of the Macao SAR, this is the first time that a debutant deputy has become directly president of the Legislative Assembly. After the transition, Susana Chou was elected as president, but she had long experience as a deputy, which she accumulated during the Portuguese Administration. He served as president between 1999 and 2009. After leaving the hemicycle, the businesswoman was replaced by Lau Cheok Vá, who had been vice-president of the AL between 1999 and 2009. Before that, the former Operários deputy was a deputy between 1984 and 1999, during the Portuguese Administration. The situation closest to that of André Cheong is that of Ho Iat Seng. The former Chief of Executive was elected deputy for the first time in 2009. And at that time he was voted vice-president of the hemicycle. However, the businessman only became president in 2014, after the departure of Lau Cheok Vá and after serving at least one term as a deputy. Past in Administration Born in Beijing in 1966, and with a degree in Portuguese from the Beijing University of Foreign Studies and in Law from the Faculty of Law of the University of Macau, André Cheong has a background in the Portuguese Administration as Conservator of the Land Registry and Director of the Justice Services Department. After the transition, he assumed the position of Director of the Justice Affairs Services Directorate between 2000 and 2014, then assuming the leadership of the Commissioner against Corruption from December 2014 to December 2019. In 2019, he was elected secretary for Administration and Justice and member of the Executive Council, positions he held until yesterday. Ho Ion Sang elected vice president Yesterday, the deputies of the Legislative Assembly also elected the vice-president, unanimously choosing Ho Ion Sang, a deputy elected indirectly and linked to the Residents of Macau. Si Ka Lon and Ella Lei were chosen as first and second secretaries of the AL, also with 33 votes each. The choice took place after the oath and inauguration of André Cheong as president of the AL, who presided over the session.

item.title: IPOR | Vila Franca de Xira wine tasting takes place today
item.description: The session open to the public of the initiative “The Reinvention of the Real” — Art and Wines in Dialogue at the Macau International Art Biennial 2025” takes place today, starting at 6:30 pm, at the Instituto Português do Oriente (IPOR) premises. The event will be attended by winemaker João Passarinho, viticulture and oenology technician at Quinta Municipal da Subserra, who will lead the tastings and comment on the selected wines, after a first session held yesterday exclusively for professionals in the sector. The event is part of “Art Macau – Macau International Art Biennial 2025”, as part of the preliminary inauguration of the Vila Franca de Xira City Pavilion, which will be on display at the Tap Seac Gallery until 16 November. According to a note from IPOR, these meetings “propose a reflection on the limits of perception and representation, bringing together artists, curators and the public around practices that challenge reality”, and these sessions include tastings of “Encostas de Xira” wines, produced by the municipality itself. Quinta Municipal da Subserra, founded in the 19th century. XVII, is ancestrally linked to agricultural activity. It is part of the Palace and Chapel of S. José, with 17th century tiles and a main altar canvas by the famous painter Bento Coelho da Silveira. The Quinta is owned by the municipality of Vila Franca de Xira and produces its own wine, “Encostas de Xira”. These wines are made from varieties such as Syrah or Touriga Nacional in the Reds and Arinto or Moscatel in the Whites, selected grapes, grown in clay-limestone soils, under the name IGP-Lisboa, describes a note from IPOR.

item.title: North Korea | NGO calls on China to end forced deportations
item.description: The non-governmental organization (NGO) Human Rights Watch called on China to end the forcible deportations of North Koreans to its country, given the “serious risk of persecution and ill-treatment”. In a statement released on Wednesday, the NGO estimated that China has deported 406 people to North Korea since the beginning of 2024, despite Chinese authorities being aware of the “oppressive conditions” in which North Koreans live. This information is based on “Stephen Kim, the pseudonym of a person with extensive contacts in North Korea and China”, whose information Human Rights Watch “has long considered reliable”, although it points to the lack of official data available. “Chinese authorities are returning hundreds of North Koreans to a place where they know that those who return will be severely persecuted,” said the head of research at Human Rights Watch in South Korea, quoted in the note. Lina Yoon urged Beijing to “immediately allow the United Nations Refugee Agency (UNHCR) access to all people at risk of forced return to North Korea”, as well as to “stop the forced repatriation of North Koreans”.

item.title: Economy | Stability forecast in the fourth quarter
item.description: The Macau Economic Association has just released the latest Prosperity Index, which forecasts a stable economy until December. According to a statement from the association, despite considering the performances of the gaming and tourism sectors during Golden Week to be excellent, there are economic areas that still perform weaker, such as consumption, credit and confidence in local investments. For this reason, the association assigned, on a scale of 0 to 10, 6.2 points, 6 points and 6.1 points, respectively, for the months of October, November and December with regard to the economic situation, which means a level of stability. Furthermore, the association highlighted that data related to tourism and gaming in the third quarter were strong, predicting positive growth in Gross Domestic Product of around 7 percent in the third quarter. Foreign Exchange Reserves | Monthly increase of 1.6% In September, the Macao SAR's foreign exchange reserves increased by 1.6 percent to 239.2 billion patacas, compared to the adjusted amounts in August. The data was released yesterday by the Macau Monetary Authority (AMCM), through a press release. In August, foreign exchange reserves reached 235.4 billion patacas. The effective exchange rate of the pataca, weighted by its trade shares, was 100.8 in September 2025, which represented a drop of 0.06 points in monthly terms and an annual reduction of 1.60 points. In view of this variation, AMCM reported that globally “the pataca fell against the currencies of Macau’s main trading partners”.

item.title: Paulo Maia and Carmo
item.description: Sun Yang, who lived in the time of Spring and Autumn (771-476 BC) because he was considered an exemplary judge in choosing a good horse, earned the honorific title of Bole from a king, «the happy eldest» and his praised ability to choose gave rise to the popular saying that says that «good horses capable of running a thousand li in a day (qianlima) are many, a Bole is rare». This would soon be adopted as a metaphor for all areas where it was necessary or vital to know how to choose talent, especially hidden talent such as in the selection of government employees. But this skill, specifically referring to horses, was especially valued in the time of the dynasty founded by the Mongol knights of the Yuan. The most notable painters of that time, such as Zhao Mengfu, portrayed several of the dynasty's most famous horses. And a court painter around the year 1342 showed, with indifference, a horse offered to the emperor, as was customary in the tax system with foreign countries, but which would remain as unexpected visual proof of the stay in the territory of a mission headed by the Florentine Franciscan Giovanni de Marignolli (c. 1290- 1358) who had arrived in Khanbaliq (present-day Beijing) as legate of the Pope in 1339-40, following the unprecedented reception of Giovanni da Montecorvino OFM (1247-1328) at the Yuan court, which even allowed him to build churches in the streets of the capital. This horizontal scroll made only in ink, a copy of which was probably made in the Ming dynasty and is in the Palace Museum in Beijing, is attributed to the court painter Zhou Lang, who created in another painting an unforgettable portrait of a poet whose memory is largely due to the testimony of a contemporary capable of recognizing her unique talent. Zhou Lang made the portrait of Du Qiuniang, «the Autumn Maiden» (791-835), with an ancient flute in his hands in a figurative style respecting the «spirit of the ancients» as Zhao Mengfu wanted, and on the model of the ladies of the Tang dynasty. From the portrait in this horizontal scroll (ink and color on silk, 32.3 x 285 cm in the Palace Museum in Beijing) was an exhortation to a prince, which would last and can be translated as: «I ask you, Lord: do not be dazzled / by the lives of those who carry gold / in the seams of their dresses/ My advice, Lord, / is that your green years / be well lived. / Pick the flowers when they bloom, / not when they are already falling, / Don’t wait until there are no longer / flowers on the broken branches.” It is known about the author that she was educated in the arts of dance and music and impressed a general who was defeated by an emperor and took her to his court and, following political conflicts, returned to her native Nanking. And it was there that, aged and impoverished, the poet Du Mu (803-52) found her, who wrote a poem about her and her brief biography.

item.title: Death | António Coelho dies aged 77, but leaves a legacy in Portuguese gastronomy
item.description: The founder of Restaurante António died on Sunday in Macau, due to heart problems. Behind him, he leaves a mark and an innovative concept for promoting Portuguese food in Asia A father, a friend and one of the great ambassadors of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia. Chef António Coelho died on Sunday, aged 77, due to heart problems, but leaves behind a professional career spanning almost 40 years and an influence that can be felt in several restaurants and Portuguese food chefs in Macau. Born in Portugal in 1948, António Coelho's first contact with Macau took place in 1970, when he had to complete his four-year mandatory military service. After two years, the land remained in his memory, but the future chef chose to return to Europe. In Portugal, he started working at Social Security, later moving to a clinical analysis laboratory. It was in this area that he developed his taste for gastronomy, not through work, but through various lunches and dinners in different restaurants. Increasingly interested in cooking, António decided to take a job, in 1984, in a restaurant, where he admitted to having learned to cook, according to an interview with the South China Morning Post newspaper, in 2018. The first years of António Coelho's new career were spent in Portugal, where he performed different roles as manager-administrator of the Botequim do Rei restaurant or director of the catering department at the Grande Hotel da Curia. In 1996, he had his first international experience, as director of the restaurant department at the Hotel Trópico, in Cape Verde. The experience lasts one year. Creating a legacy Returning to Macau in 1997, António worked for 10 years in different spaces, such as the restaurants Frol de la Mar, Lusitano, Lisbon, and also had a brief stay in Hong Kong, in 2002, at Restaurante Inn. However, the decisive step towards his affirmation as one of the most influential chefs of Portuguese gastronomy in Asia came in 2007, with the opening of Restaurante António. And the success that followed was not the result of chance, as said by Edgar Rodrigues, a chef who came to Macau to work on the launch of the project: “The success was based on the recipes, the quality of the food, but also the very professionalism”, says Edgar Rodrigues, to HM. "He was very attentive to his customers. If there was an order for clams à bolhão pato, he would have different recipes adapted to the nationality. For example, Koreans don't like coriander, the recipe for them didn't have coriander. Chinese customers like little salt, they were served with little salt, and locals like the more traditional recipe. In a single dish there were several ways of cooking, just to satisfy different customers", he recalls. Cristiano Tavares, currently chef at the Macalhau restaurant, also came to Macau to work at the António Restaurant. He believes that the chef found a position for Portuguese food that still influences other restaurants today. “I think his success was due to his way of being, he was a politically correct person, he had a way of working that pleased both Chinese, Korean and Japanese tourists”, explained Cristiano Tavares, to HM. "We were a street restaurant with four or five cooks. He managed to do what many large restaurants still cannot do today. Nowadays there are many restaurants with Portuguese food that open in Macau, but follow the example of what he did", he considered. Quality and spectacle In addition to the food, Restaurante António customers were seduced by the “show”. This is the vision of Marcelino Marques, António's friend and musician who for several years livened up the space's nights, with traditional Portuguese music. "The quality of the food made the space popular. He took great care in choosing the food and drinks served. He went to Portugal to choose wines from various regions, such as Douro or Alentejo, all of high quality, which were bottled under the António brand. People knew they weren't going to pay little, not that it was a space with luxury prices, it wasn't, but the quantity served wasn't small", recalled Marcelino Marques. However, the musician believes that the success was also due to a concept in which the meal was also a spectacle: "People liked listening to Portuguese music, but also being with António. He was an affable, big person and appeared in that white jacket with the flags of Portugal, China and Macau and people liked his presence and asked him to take photographs", he says. "He also opened a bottle of champagne with a sword. He did a whole ceremony and people really liked it. It was a spectacle and a party to see the cork flying out of the bottle. It worked well", he recalled. Marcelino Marques recalls that the food and the show made the restaurant very famous, especially among Japanese, Korean and Hong Kong tourists. The musician reveals that Japanese tourists booked days in advance. And this factor also contributed to the fact that António offered a glass of port wine at the end of the meal, which also led to the recognition of the Port Wine Confraternity. The success of Restaurante António led the chef to sell the space to an investment fund, becoming an ambassador for the space. The break with the fund happened in 2020, when he was fired without just cause. The case ended up in court, with António winning the case. In recent years, António took on the position of executive chef at Angela’s Café and Lounge, at the Hotel Lisboeta. A father, a friend Due to his work in Macau, António was distinguished, in 2013, by the Macao SAR Government with the MSAR Tourist Merit Medal. Also in 2015, he received the merit medal for Portuguese communities from the Portuguese Government. However, for those who worked with him the most important thing was the relationship that went beyond the strictly professional field. "He had a big impact on Macau and for me he was like a second father. When I came to Macau I didn't have an easy life and he always held my hand", confessed Rodrigues. "He was always a person who was there for me. And I always saw him as a man of iron. In everything he did, there was a great will", he pointed out. This is a feeling shared by Cristiano Tavares. "António is my father in Macau. He worked until the last day, always with seriousness, honesty and integrity. He is an example for all the chefs in this area", he said. For Marcelino Marques, António's death is the loss of a friend. "António was the person who welcomed me to Macau and was capable of doing the same to everyone. He was strict and demanding, but he was an excellent person", he described. "Everyone knew him. He was an affable person and received people like no one else", he added.

item.title: Chemistry | Nobel Prize for the development of metal-organic structures
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Chemistry was awarded to Susumu Kitagawa, from Kyoto University, Richard Robson, from the University of Melbourne, and Omar M. Yaghi, from the University of California, “for the development of metal-organic structures”, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences announced yesterday. Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have developed a new form of molecular architecture – metal-organic frameworks – that can be used to collect water from desert air, capture carbon dioxide, store toxic gases or catalyze chemical reactions. The three laureates created molecular constructs with large spaces through which gases and other chemicals could flow. The president of the Nobel Committee for Chemistry, Heiner Linque, highlighted precisely the fact that these “metal-organic structures have enormous potential, bringing previously unforeseen opportunities for personalized materials with new functions”. The research that led to the discovery of this new form of molecular architecture began nearly four decades ago, in 1989, when Richard Robson tested the use of the inherent properties of atoms by combining positively charged copper ions with a four-armed molecule. When combined, they bonded "to form a spacious, well-ordered crystal. It was like a diamond filled with countless cavities," the academy explains. Robson immediately realized the potential of his molecular construction, but it was still unstable and crumbled easily. It was chemists Susumu Kitagawa and Omar Yaghi who managed to provide a solid foundation for this construction method. Notable applications Following the discoveries of the three laureates, chemists built tens of thousands of different MOFs. Some of them could contribute to solving some of humanity's biggest challenges, with applications including breaking down traces of pharmaceuticals in the environment, capturing carbon dioxide or collecting water from desert air. The discovery also allows the separation of perfluoroalkylated and polyfluoroalkylated substances (PFAS) from water. PFAS are a group of synthetic chemical compounds known as “forever chemicals” due to their extreme persistence in the environment and in the human body. PFAS are used in a wide range of industrial and household products, such as stain- and water-resistant textiles, food packaging, non-stick cookware and firefighting foams. Its accumulation in the environment and potential health risks, including liver damage and other problems, have led to concerns and a search for safer alternatives.

item.title: Study | Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the USA in 2024
item.description: North American President Donald Trump was the main disseminator of disinformation in the United States of America (USA) in 2024, concluded a study by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ). “US President Donald Trump was the dominant source and distributor of disinformation” in 2024, say the authors of the study “Disarming Disinformation: United States”. The study highlights that Trump has drawn on the functions of domestic political forces, rather than foreign state actors, as the main source of disinformation narratives in US political discourse. Furthermore, the existence of WhatsApp groups and other closed digital spaces often act as “information cocoons” that encourage rumors and other forms of misinformation. In this way, "the viral spread of misinformation and the strategic attack on journalists have emerged as interconnected threats to democracy. In an era of increasing authoritarianism and democratic backsliding, falsehoods are often used as a weapon by state actors to influence public opinion, undermine journalism and intimidate journalists." The study authors state that these factors are increasingly the North American reality, with Donald Trump “promulgating manifestly false narratives” in recent years. “The American media faces a profound information crisis, at a time of repression of freedom of expression”, the study reads. In this sense, trust in the mainstream press continues to decline in a climate of increasing attacks on the media by the Trump Government. The study published by the International Center for Journalists (ICFJ) was based on the analysis of 10,000 news and media publications during 2024, as well as a survey of 1,020 Americans.

item.title: Cuts leave 13.7 million people at risk of extreme hunger
item.description: Cuts in humanitarian aid funding could expose up to 13.7 million people to extreme hunger around the world, the World Food Program (WFP) warned yesterday. “The humanitarian aid system is under severe pressure as partners withdraw from frontline areas, creating a void,” the Rome-based agency said in a new report titled “A lifebuoy in danger.” The UN agency said that six of its operations – in Afghanistan, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan – are “facing major disruptions, which will only worsen”. WFP warned that its financing “has never been so challenging”, anticipating “a 40 percent drop” in 2025, “which will translate into a projected budget of US$6.4 billion, compared to US$10 billion in 2024”. The report does not name any countries, but points to a study published in the medical journal The Lancet, which found that 14 million additional deaths worldwide from disease, nutritional deficiencies and maternal and perinatal conditions could occur by 2030 as a result of cuts in US humanitarian aid alone. Returns and records Since US President Donald Trump's return to the White House, Washington has announced massive cuts in its foreign aid, dealing a huge blow to humanitarian operations around the world. "Program coverage has been significantly reduced and rations cut. Vital assistance to families in food disaster situations [Phase 5 of the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification/IPC] is threatened, while preparedness for future impacts has significantly decreased," warns WFP. Globally, “WFP estimates that its funding gaps could push 10.5 to 13.7 million people currently in acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3) into a humanitarian emergency (IPC Phase 4),” the organization added. The UN agency said global hunger has now reached record levels, with 319 million people facing acute food insecurity — including 44 million at emergency levels.

item.title: Scientists ‘reduce’ the age of the Egyptian temple of Karnak, in Egypt
item.description: Researchers have carried out the most comprehensive geoarchaeological study of the Karnak temple, near Luxor, and revealed suggestive links to ancient Egyptian mythology and new data about the interaction between the complex's riverine landscape and the people who occupied the site during its almost 3,000 years of use. The results of the investigation were published on Monday in Antiquity magazine, reported the Efe news agency. Researchers from the University of Southampton, in the United Kingdom, and Uppsala University, in Sweden, participated in the study. Up to 61 sediment samples from the interior and surroundings of the temple and thousands of ceramic fragments found in the Karnak complex, located 500 meters east of the current Nile River, near Luxor, in the ancient Egyptian religious capital of Thebes, were analyzed. The researchers mapped how the landscape around the site changed throughout its history and found that, before 2520 BC, the site could not have been suitable for permanent occupation due to periodic flooding caused by the Nile's strong currents. Therefore, they placed the earliest occupation at Karnak during the Old Kingdom (between 2591 and 2152 BC). Pottery fragments found at the site corroborate this discovery, with the oldest dating between 2305 and 1980 BC. Therefore, the conclusions of this international team of researchers provide new evidence about the age of Karnak, which has been hotly debated in archaeological circles for decades. The origin of everything The ground on which the temple was founded was formed when river channels advanced west and east, creating an island of high ground in what is now the east-southeast region of the site. This emerging island laid the foundation for the occupation and initial construction of Karnak. Over the following centuries and millennia, the river channels on both sides of the site diverged further, creating more space for the development of the temple complex, as researchers have now confirmed. This new understanding of the temple's landscape bears striking similarities to an ancient Egyptian creation myth, leading the team to believe that the decision to locate the temple there may have been related to the religious views of its inhabitants. Ancient Egyptian texts from the Old Kingdom indicate that the 'Creator God' manifested himself as high ground emerging from the lake, and researchers have found that the island where Karnak was founded is the only known area of ​​high ground surrounded by water in the region. Thus, archaeologists have suggested that the Theban elites chose the location of Karnak to be the abode of a new form of 'Creator God', alluding to Amun-Ra, the supreme god of ancient Egypt, since the location fit perfectly into the mythological setting of the highlands that emerged from the surrounding waters as the origin of the formation of the Universe.

item.title: Physics | Nobel Prize for Macroscopic Quantum Mechanical Tunneling
item.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics was awarded to John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret and John M. Martinis “for the discovery of macroscopic quantum mechanical tunneling and the quantization of energy in an electrical circuit”, announced yesterday the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. "An important question in physics is the maximum size of a system capable of demonstrating the effects of quantum mechanics. This year's Nobel Prize laureates carried out experiments with an electrical circuit in which they demonstrated both quantum tunneling and quantized energy levels in a system large enough to be held in the hand", explains the Swedish Academy of Sciences in a statement published on its website. The British John Clarke carried out his research at the University of California, Berkeley, USA; the American John Martinis at the University of California, Santa Barbara; and the Frenchman Michel Devoret at Yale University and also in California, Santa Barbara. According to academia, quantum mechanics allows a particle to directly cross a barrier, through a process called tunneling. When a large number of particles are involved, quantum effects usually become negligible. The experiments of the now distinguished scientists demonstrated that quantum properties can be made concrete on a macroscopic scale. "It is wonderful to be able to celebrate the way in which quantum mechanics, more than a century old, continues to offer new surprises. It is also extremely useful, as it is the basis of all digital technology", said the president of the Nobel Committee for Physics, Olle Eriksson, quoted in the statement. The Swedish academy says that transistors in computer microchips are an example of consolidated quantum technology. The scientists today awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics share a prize of 11 million Swedish kronor (almost one million euros).

item.title: Linguistics | Published study based on a trip to Macau in the 19th century
item.description:
Academic Anabela Leal de Barros has just published a linguistic study that focuses on the trip of Father Miranda e Oliveira, linked to the Congregation of the Mission, to Macau in 1825. With touches of history, details are revealed about the Portuguese of the time and of Macau. The book will be presented at the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center next Wednesday
“Journey from Lisbon to Macau – 1825” is the title of the most recent work published by Grão-Falar, written by University of Minho academic Anabela Leal de Barros. The book makes a critical and interpretative analysis of the Portuguese of the time left in the manuscript of parish priest José Joaquim de Miranda e Oliveira, priest of the Congregation of the Mission. This documentation is kept by the Braga District Archive. However, the work does not just explore the Portuguese of the time, revealing other historical details of Macau, Asia and a sea voyage. As Anabela Leal de Barros told HM, the work is “as faithful as possible to the spelling of the manuscript”, until now practically unknown. In this travel diary, Father Miranda e Oliveira “reveals enormous curiosity about all the news and shares with us their names in the languages ​​of the world in which they were baptized, starting with ours”. This is how he explains situations such as “seasickness, a reality that was still relatively unknown and highly invasive on boats” in those times. The priest named or defined “the mangalhões, the porpoises, the caravels, the black-eyed peas, the flies, the albacores — all sorts of birds and fish that were admired, fished or tasted throughout the trip”, or even the “meteorological phenomena with local names – cacimba, samatra, typhoon”. There are also details about “cultural habits such as the masca, buio in Indonesian; the Philippine seges, the berloches, and the ruling class of the camisolas, as well as the sômas, Chinese vessels”. The vessel left Lisbon in April 1825 and spent time in the Philippines, arriving in Macau on October 23rd. The arrival “to the island of Caó” and the following day “to Colégio de S. José” is described, to “a city with ‘a magnificent port of commerce’, located ‘on a very pleasant peninsula’, with ‘good waters’ and ‘famous European-style buildings'”. Linguistic varieties In the work published by Grão-Falar there are, for example, “rich stories such as that of Orvalhadas de S. João, Caldeirão de Frei Junípero or the habit of seafarers shouting ‘Refresca S. Lourenço!’ so that the wind blows, this being the meaning here of ‘refresh’”. There are also “allusions to the linguistic variety itself”, as “at various times there is reference to communication with foreigners carried out in Latin, in Indonesian-Dutch and Filipino-Spanish territory; the private teaching of English in the Philippines by members of the Congregation of the Mission; the little knowledge and use of Spanish, even in Manila, and the variation of Tagalog itself, a language in which the priest is concerned about recording the Hail Mary.” Before arriving at this travel report, Anabela Leal de Barros was already in the intricacies of investigating this type of manuscripts, coming across the story of another priest, “the greatest Portuguese sinologist, Joaquim Afonso Gonçalves, who had traveled from the same house as Rilhafoles of the Congregation of the Mission to Macau in 1812”. According to the author, this parish priest “dedicated the last twenty-nine years of his life to the mission of evangelization in China, and in particular to the research and teaching of Chinese at the Colégio de S. José in Macau”. In his entire life, “this Trás-os-Montes native wrote more than five thousand pages of grammars and dictionaries in Portuguese, Latin and Chinese, expressly dedicated to his students at the College, seven printed in his typography and at least two manuscripts”. Then, in 2017, António Lázaro, from the History Department of the University of Minho, and director of the Confúcio Institute, made available to Anabela Leal de Barros “a list of references to manuscripts from the Braga District Archive about Macau and China”. A “journey” began, which culminated in the publication of this study. “This book is the first result of a project of mine to edit and study unpublished travel literature manuscripts whose main objective is exactly this: to contribute to the appreciation and consolidation of the micro-history of the Discoveries and the memory of history, between the 15th and 19th centuries”. Accompanied on travel José Joaquim de Miranda e Oliveira took around seven months to arrive in Macau, leaving Lisbon on April 1, 1825, and arriving in Oriente on October 24 of the same year. He left on the ship Vasco da Gama with three other priests from the congregation: João da França de Castro e Moura, Jerónimo José da Mata and José́ Ferreira da Silva. According to Anabela Leal de Barros, “the manuscript does not appear to have been cleaned by the author himself, given the type of spelling variations and typos and amendments it presents”, having probably been “translated, to safeguard copies, by a Macanese member of the College, since Macau Portuguese, in the 19th century, had characteristics compatible with certain traits, strange in a priest arrived from Portugal, even how young.” This travel diary “ends on the very day of arrival in Macau, with a very brief presentation of the city and the school, making clear the Catholic perspective of the time in relation to the Chinese cult of ancestors and without failing to draw attention to the mere five thousand Christians among the 40 to 50 thousand inhabitants of the city”. Political hostilities José Joaquim de Miranda e Oliveira describes how the bishop of Macau did not receive the delegation, which is “enough to lead us to the hostile context in which the Lazarists, defenders of liberalism, found themselves, which had led Joaquim Afonso Gonçalves, a few years earlier, to take refuge in the Philippines, with the school missing two of its teachers”. Furthermore, “along the journey the priest does not fail to narrate all the moments in which he carries out his daily mission, with the administration of the sacraments, the prayer of responsos and the celebration of masses, but above all he notes the notable lack of priests who reveal the Christianized peoples, particularly in Batavia, now Jakarta, where the community of Portuguese origin, of more than a thousand people, had only an old priest.” These reports also reveal the concern to “remember the first French martyrs of the Congregation in the attempt to evangelize Madagascar and to report the presence of friars and priests from the different congregations, from Cape Verde to the Philippines, where they are recognized as more important for the solidity of Spanish rule than its army”. According to Anabela Leal de Barros, the report also alluded, in Java, “to the Lutherans and Mohammedans, as well as to the religions of China and, in Manila, to the persecution of Christians (referring to the ‘dinner’, that is, lunch with a Chinese Christian, ‘and as such persecuted’)”. Miranda and Oliveira had “a very diplomatic and convivial conduct, ensuring the establishment and maintenance of cordial relations between the various orders and also with the governors and foreign powers present, from the Dutch to the Spanish, who visited everywhere”. An ongoing project In those years, it was a dangerous adventure to travel by boat, facing “anthropogenic peoples, piracy, diseases on ships and epidemics”, a “perfectly cinematic vision” already described in Os Lusíadas, by Luís de Camões. Those who embarked on these trips also found themselves alone, “individually and on a small ship little more than a walnut shell, facing an endless sea, for months, at times when it was common for several passengers not to reach their destination, or for not even one ship from a full squadron to return”. In Miranda and Oliveira's report, “there is no great news” compared to previous reports, but “we are aware of the main difficulties of sea voyages to Asia in the 19th century: the rocks that existed even before the Torre de Belém, which caused many shipwrecks; and seasickness, which even deserves a definition for the many readers who had never set foot on a boat, and to which the captain's face advising the sick ladies going up to the awning and working, as it was the best medicine”. There is also “the episode of the man falling overboard from the plow that accompanied them on part of the trip, which they were unable to save — a death to which everyone was so exposed, as the narrator refers”. Another potential misfortune in trips of this type also stands out, “the encounter with ships that, not immediately raising any flag, or raising it without giving true confidence, immediately led to the decision to light the hills and open fire, which well reflects the dimension of piracy and the fears it imposed”. Essentially, “the main character of sea voyages was the wind”, which led the still “young priest” to “evoke the Camonian verses of the storm twice”. After arriving in Macau, Miranda e Oliveira left for his post in Nanking, “on a journey comparatively longer than the first, received by the Christians with difficulty and secretly”. “In the face of persecution” he ended up succumbing “to the dangers and illnesses of the mainland, at the age of 31, far from all his confreres, on November 1, 1828, just two years after having described the difficult farewell to his spiritual family, in Lisbon”. “His traveling companions had more longevity, one of whom would become Bishop of Macau and the other of Beijing and Porto”, highlights Anabela Leal de Barros.

item.title: LAG 2026 | Macau in a “key phase” of diversification, says secretary
item.description: The Secretary for Economy and Finance, Tai Kin Ip, recently met with several associations in order to obtain their opinions for the preparation of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for next year. Quoted in an official note, Tai Kin Ip considered that “Macau is at a key stage in promoting economic diversification”, having promised, within the scope of these meetings, “to further optimize the business environment”. Another of the guarantees left by the government official refers to “support for small and medium-sized companies to improve their quality, stabilize local employment, create more development opportunities for residents and continually improve measures to guarantee the well-being of the population”. The General Association of Women of Macau, General Association of Fukien Countrymen of Macau, Macau Institution People's Alliance, General Union of Residents' Associations of Macau, Commercial Association of Macau, Industrial Association of Macau, Macau Youth Federation, Federation of Workers' Associations of Macau and General Association of Overseas Chinese of Macau met with Tai Kin Ip.

item.title: Government reformulation | Chan Tsz King admits he has little experience in the area
item.description: The new Secretary for Security, Chan Tsz King, admitted yesterday that he had little experience for the position he has held since yesterday, replacing Wong Sio Chak. “For me, this is a very big challenge because I have never had contact with the security area and have little experience in this area”, he said, according to statements reproduced by TDM. The new secretary highlighted the quality of the team he will work with, which has “experienced personnel”, namely the director general of the Customs Services and Unitary Police Services. Furthermore, Chan Tsz King highlighted that “the issue of national security is very important for Macau society”, awaiting “long-term developments and legal diplomas that are being produced”. Regarding the Lines of Government Action (LAG) for next year, for this guardianship, Chan Tsz King said that they are already being prepared. “For my part, the main thing is to adjust to this area and master the details.” Chan Tsz King was a commissioner of the Commissariat against Corruption (CCAC), between 2019 and 2024, but began his career in public service as a delegate of the Public Prosecutor's Office in 1997. He was then promoted to the position of deputy prosecutor in March 2000, having been seconded to carry out duties in the Public Prosecutor's Service at the Courts of Second and Final Instances from January 2012 to December 2019. The new Secretary for Security was born in Hong Kong in 1970 and has higher education completed in Portugal, namely at the Faculty of Arts of the University of Lisbon in Portugal, completed in 1989, and a Law course completed at the Autonomous University of Lisbon in Portugal in 1995. MP | Tong Hio Fong talks “great responsibility” Tong Hio Fong, who assumed the role of Public Prosecutor (MP) of the Macao SAR yesterday, as part of the government reform, thanked the “confidence of the Central Government and the Chief Executive” in assuming an “important and highly responsible position”. The official also added that he will “contribute to the development of the Macao SAR”, describing the territory as a successful example of the practice of one country, two systems, with “long-term stability and prosperity being ensured by the rule of law”. In turn, Tong Hio Fong said that the MP “is an important institution to defend the rule of law, being responsible for defending the dignity of the law, protecting the rights of citizens and combating illegal activities”. As Prosecutor, he promised to focus “on the principle of the rule of law, apply the law rigorously and fairly and strengthen inspection of judicial activities”, as well as “increase judicial efficiency”. Administration | Wong Sio Chak collects opinions on markets Upon assuming a vast portfolio, that of Administration and Justice, Wong Sio Chak, former Secretary for Security, promised that, in the coming weeks, he will listen to the population's opinions regarding the functioning of markets. "In the near future I will visit the communities, in particular the markets. I will continue to do this [listen to opinions]. The means to receive the public's opinions are always unimpeded", he told the press. To journalists, Wong Sio Chak thanked the work carried out by his predecessor, André Cheong, ensuring that he will now focus on four areas that he believes are priorities, such as the reform of Public Administration, strengthening the construction of “One country, two systems”, greater efficiency in governance and promoting integration in the Greater Bay Area and the Hengqin Deep Cooperation Zone. "Regardless of government or local services, it is easy to appear bad habits, such as sectarianism, bureaucracy or isolated actions. These situations also occur in Macau and we need to change that. We need to facilitate horizontal communication [within the Public Service] and increase the effectiveness of cooperation", he added. Wong Sio Chak argued that it is necessary to “increase staff capacity, explore their potential and make good use of talent, optimizing the allocation of employees”. In this way, the governor considers that “it is necessary to create more concrete training actions, especially in the capacity building of services”. Wong Sio Chak, was born in Guangdong province in 1968 and graduated in Law from Peking University. After a long career in the Judiciary Police, he was appointed Secretary for Security in 2014.

item.title: Legislative Assembly | André Cheong unanimously elected president
item.description: Cheong Weng Chon, Cheong Weng Chon and Cheong Weng Chon... was the name repeated by the 33 deputies in the voting papers, including his own, which confirmed the choice of the new president of the AL “I want to take on this position”, this is how André Cheong reacted after being elected the new president of the Legislative Assembly. Later, the former secretary for Administration and Justice reminded journalists that the new legislative session will have “new deputies from different industries” and will take into account “the successful experiences of the last seven legislatures”. “I hope that there will be progress in legislative and supervisory work, so that the governance of the Macao SAR can be carried out with greater cooperation from the Legislative Assembly (AL)”, he added. André Cheong also said he hopes that “the projects and law proposals and policies [of the Executive] correspond to the opinions of the population and social hope through the AL, which is an important platform”. In yesterday's session, before the election, José Pereira Coutinho, the oldest deputy at 67 years old, was responsible for conducting the work of the first plenary, as traditionally happens. Speaking exclusively in Cantonese, the Portuguese proposed that the votes on the future president of the hemicycle be counted by the youngest deputies Chan Lai Kei and Loi I Weng. The proposal was approved by all deputies, after a vote with a show of hands. A new vote followed, secret and with a ballot paper, to choose the future president of the Legislative Assembly. An orderly procedure, with deputies standing up according to their place in the hemicycle's rows, and which only highlighted the future president's difficulties in folding the ballot paper, which he had to do when he was already in front of the ballot box, and after a first failed attempt. Once the vote was over, Chan Lai Kei and Loi I Weng read their vote and that of their colleagues and the name Cheong Weng Chon was repeated 33 times, which confirmed that the person who until yesterday was the Government's number two, as secretary for Administration and Justice, would be the new president of the hemicycle. With unanimity confirmed, José Pereira Coutinho addressed the now deputy appointed by the Chief Executive and asked him if he accepted the new position: “I want to take on this position”, replied André Cheong. Different results Yesterday's vote also marked a difference compared to what happened in 2019 and 2021, when Kou Hoi In was elected president of the hemicycle. In 2019, Kou was chosen president in the middle of a Legislature, after Ho Iat Seng abdicated his position as deputy to run for Chief Executive. In that vote, when the hemicycle was operating with only 32 deputies, given the place left free by Ho, Kou was elected with 29 votes in favor, José Pereira Coutinho had one vote and there were two blank votes. In 2021, Kou Hoi In was re-elected, in a parliament that for the first time had seen several candidate deputies excluded for political reasons. Still, despite there being 33 voters, Kou had 32 votes, since José Chui Sai Peng also gathered one vote. Unprecedented case In almost 25 years of the Macao SAR, this is the first time that a debutant deputy has become directly president of the Legislative Assembly. After the transition, Susana Chou was elected as president, but she had long experience as a deputy, which she accumulated during the Portuguese Administration. He served as president between 1999 and 2009. After leaving the hemicycle, the businesswoman was replaced by Lau Cheok Vá, who had been vice-president of the AL between 1999 and 2009. Before that, the former Operários deputy was a deputy between 1984 and 1999, during the Portuguese Administration. The situation closest to that of André Cheong is that of Ho Iat Seng. The former Chief of Executive was elected deputy for the first time in 2009. And at that time he was voted vice-president of the hemicycle. However, the businessman only became president in 2014, after the departure of Lau Cheok Vá and after serving at least one term as a deputy. Past in Administration Born in Beijing in 1966, and with a degree in Portuguese from the Beijing University of Foreign Studies and in Law from the Faculty of Law of the University of Macau, André Cheong has a background in the Portuguese Administration as Conservator of the Land Registry and Director of the Justice Services Department. After the transition, he assumed the position of Director of the Justice Affairs Services Directorate between 2000 and 2014, then assuming the leadership of the Commissioner against Corruption from December 2014 to December 2019. In 2019, he was elected secretary for Administration and Justice and member of the Executive Council, positions he held until yesterday. Ho Ion Sang elected vice president Yesterday, the deputies of the Legislative Assembly also elected the vice-president, unanimously choosing Ho Ion Sang, a deputy elected indirectly and linked to the Residents of Macau. Si Ka Lon and Ella Lei were chosen as first and second secretaries of the AL, also with 33 votes each. The choice took place after the oath and inauguration of André Cheong as president of the AL, who presided over the session.

item.title: Airport | Expansion guarantees capacity for 13 million visitors
item.description:
Even before the increase in passenger capacity, the airport will receive a larger parking area for aircraft, with the number of spaces increasing to 56 compared to the current 36
By the end of 2030, Macau International Airport will have the capacity to receive 13 million passengers per year. The figures were presented by a representative of the Civil Aviation Authority (AACM), at the most recent meeting of the Islands' Community Services Advisory Council, which took place on Monday. The summary of the meeting was given to the newspaper Ou Mun by counselors Li Yongjian and Ieong Weng Kuong, who cited the responses from the AACM meeting. According to the explanations mentioned, expansion works are underway, after having started in April. The new parking area is expected to be completed in 2028, which will increase aircraft parking spaces from the current 36 to 56 spaces, an increase of 55.6 percent. At the same time, it was indicated that estimates indicate that the expansion works will be fully completed in 2030, within around five years, and that at that time the airport will have the capacity to handle another two million travelers, compared to the current capacity of 11 million per year. Last year, the airport received 7.6 million travelers, two million fewer than the record number of passengers reached in 2019, even before the pandemic, when there were 9.6 million travelers using the infrastructure. However, the number appears to show a further reduction. Between January and October this year, around 5.5 million passengers were recorded. Last year, in the first ten months, there were 5.7 million passengers. Largest area With ongoing work, the total area of ​​the airport will be increased to 325 hectares, compared to the current 177 hectares. At the meeting, the councilors also addressed other issues related to the airport, such as issues related to security and passenger transport between the boarding pier and the planes. In this sense, counselors were assured that given the current limitations on the number of boarding lanes available, that passenger transportation between the boarding pier and the aircraft will continue to be done via buses. This will also be the method used for future aircraft parking spaces. During the meeting, according to Li Yongjian and Ieong Weng Kuong, there were also advisors calling for the development of more complementary facilities at the airport, as well as paying special attention to ensuring that the transport center is prepared to deal with the flow of passengers that occurs during large-scale events, such as the recent NBA pre-season games in Macau.

item.title: Sam Hou Fai talks about “new phase” of the principle of one country, two systems
item.description: The Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, said yesterday that “Macau has entered the new phase of applying the principle of one country, two systems” and that it is struggling “with profound and complex changes in the internal and external environment”, in addition to that the world finds itself “in a new period of turbulence and change”. Speaking at an event celebrating the 105th anniversary of the Macau Red Cross Foundation, Sam Hou Fai recalled that “compatriots need more humanistic care and spiritual comfort”, and therefore hopes that the Red Cross “will continue to pay attention and support to the development of the Macao SAR and the Government's actions”. The governor defended that this century-old organization must be attentive to “government plans and demands for the high-quality development of Macau in the new journey”, with the hope that there will be reinforced cooperation with the Chinese Red Cross Society. Long life The Chief Executive highlighted that the Macau Red Cross has been “rooted” in the territory since 1920, and, in addition to “serving Macau, it also closely monitors and supports humanitarian services and activities of public interest in Mainland China and internationally”. The highest ruler of the MSAR did not forget the moment of transition, when the “Red Cross of Macau officially became the Delegation with a high degree of autonomy of the Red Cross Society of China, being a witness, participant and contributor to the successful application of the principle of one country, two systems with Macau characteristics”. Still on governance, Sam Hou Fai promised to “build a Macau based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy”, continuing with the “focus on supporting the most vulnerable layers” and assuming “the reinforcement of the feeling of fulfillment, happiness and security of all Macau residents as the starting point and basis of government action”. It was also guaranteed that the Executive “will fully support the Macau Red Cross in the planning and development of activities”.

item.title: Hainan | Taking advantage of Macau to import Portuguese-speaking products
item.description:
During a visit to Forum Macau, governor Liu Xiaoming said he wanted to create synergies with the Macao SAR so that Portuguese-speaking products can enter the interior
The leader of the island of Hainan stated yesterday that he wants to help Portuguese-speaking products enter the Chinese market, defending synergies with Macau and Portuguese-speaking countries. Governor Liu Xiaoming pointed out as a goal “the construction of Hainan as a hub for the entry of products from Portuguese-speaking countries into the interior of China”. Liu was speaking during a visit to the facilities of the Forum for Economic and Trade Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries, known as the Macau Forum. According to Forum Macau, the leader of Hainan asked the organization for support, also to help companies on the island “to deepen their knowledge of market rules and investment environments in Portuguese-speaking nations”. According to a statement, Liu defended the bet on “synergistic development between Hainan, Macau and Portuguese-speaking countries” and recalled that the island will become a free port before the end of the year. From December 18, imported products that are processed in Hainan – with an added value of at least 30 percent – ​​can enter mainland China without paying customs duties. Bet on the advantages On Monday, even before going to Forum Macau, Liu Xiaoming had a meeting with Sam Hou Fai. According to a statement from the Macau Government, Sam argued that there may be “complementarity of advantages” between the free port of Hainan and the Deep Cooperation Zone between Guangdong and Macau. This special economic zone, jointly managed by Guangdong province and Macau, was launched by Beijing and 2021 and covers around 106 square kilometers on Mountain Island, adjacent to Macau. China established Macau as a platform for strengthening economic and trade cooperation with Portuguese-speaking countries in 2003 and, in that same year, created the Macau Forum. The organization includes, in addition to China, the nine Portuguese-speaking countries: Angola, Brazil, Cape Verde, Guinea-Bissau, Mozambique, Portugal, São Tomé and Príncipe, Timor-Leste and, since 2022, Equatorial Guinea. Exports from Portuguese-speaking countries to China fell 11.3 percent to $86.6 billion in the first eight months of the year, according to official data.

item.title: AL | Deputies take office this morning
item.description: The deputies of the Legislative Assembly take office this morning for the beginning of the VIII Legislature. The oath is scheduled for 11 am, in the meeting room of the Service Platform Complex for Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries. In the afternoon, at 3pm, the first session of the Plenary of the Legislative Assembly is scheduled, which will serve to elect the future president, vice-president, first secretary and second secretary. After the meeting, there will be another oath session, on the same day, at 4 pm, and the AL president will be sworn in. The session also takes place at the Service Platform Complex for Commercial Cooperation between China and Portuguese-speaking Countries. Following the government reshuffle, Wong Sio Chak and Chan Tsz King will hold the oath and inauguration ceremony this morning, at 10am, at the Government headquarters. Wong Sio Chak will take on the role of Secretary for Administration and Justice, while Chan Tsz King will be the new Secretary for Security. In the 10 am session, the first of three that will take place tomorrow, the oath ceremony and inauguration of Tong Hio Fong as Prosecutor of the Macao SAR and the new members of the Executive Council are also scheduled. The ceremony is not open to the public. AMCM | Chan Kuan I appointed to Board of Directors Chan Kuan I was appointed member of the Board of Directors of the Macau Monetary Authority (AMCM).
